intro: Lavauxia primiveris, commonly known as the early primrose, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Lavauxia primiveris blooms in early spring, making it one of the first wildflowers to appear after winter.
